title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message:
Hi, I got this board, it changes from 5v to 19,5v, tries to run, but when it gets to ,500A it goes back to 0 and stays there

PPBUS_G3H = 12,64
PPBUS_HS_CPU =12,64
PPDCIN_G3H = 20V
PP5V_G3S = 5,139
PP5V_S5_LDO = 5,139
PPVIN_G3H_P5VG3S= 12,64
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H= 12,64
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3HRTC= 12,64
PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN=3,3
PP3V3_G3S_WLANBT= 3,29
PPBUS_G3H_SSD0= 12,64
PPBUS_G3H_TPAD= 12,64
PP3V3_G3H_RTC =3,3
PP3V3_G3H= 3,3
PP3V3_G3SSW_SNS = 0
PP3V3_G3S= 0
PP3V3_TBT_X_S0= 0
PP2V7_NAND=0
PP1V8_G3S= 1,8

Never worked on this board before, don´t know where to start... it looks pretty clean though...

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message: Check which big coils get voltage then.

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message: When it’s at .500A I should check the voltages, right?

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message: Yeah, all secondary power supplies (big coils).

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message:
L8100= ,500v (pulses on goes down)
L8410= ,015v
L8102=,900v (pulses and goes down)
L7410= 0
L7430= 0
L7210= ,900v (pulse and goes down)
L7230= ,900v (pulse and goes down)
L7290= 1,1 (pulse and goes down)
L7030= this one does wierd stuff, when usb c connected, right away you get 5,1v, then at ,500A I get 12,64v when the amperage drops, it goes to 3.3v and then to ,800v and starts droping...
L7690= 3,3v
L7670= 5,1v
L9060= 2,4v

each and every measure was taken when the board was at ,500a consumption

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message: Check if you can get into DFU mode.

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message: I was able to get the computer into DFU mode, I tried to reinstall the firmware but got stuck on the 4th step "installing system" and the a message with this error: AMrestoreErrorDomain 9 - Failed to recieve message from device. AMRestoreErrorDomain - 0x9 (9)

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message:
Check if you get all SSD voltages.

Any history available, liquid sign on audio board, or flex/connector?

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message:
PP0V9_SSD
PP1V8_SSD
PPBUS_G3H_SSD0

are these all the SSD voltages?

No liquid, no liquid sign on audio board

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message:
with the board in the case and everything connected:
PP0V9_SSD = ,906
PP1V8_SSD= 1,809
PPBUS_G3H_SSD0= 12,08
PP2V7_NAND= 2,49

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message: I was trying DFU  mode and found out that it only works on one of the USB C ports... when I try to put the computer in DFU when connected to the port closer to the monitor it just don´t get into DFU and even the computer to which I am connecting it gives an alert that the accesorie is not compatible, the usb c cable is original and when connected to the secondary usb c, it recognizes it with no problems...

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message:
You should know that exists a dedicated port for DFU!
Still get the same error?

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message: Sorry, I didn’t, still doing the same, sometimes it shows the computer in recovery, then I put it on DFU but it can’t complete the process in neither modes.

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message:
Where did you get the board?
There should be some history fault...

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message: The customer reports that it was dropped but not too hard... after that it continued working and suddenly it just stopped turning on... thats all the history I have...

title: 820-01521-02 19v 0A
message:
Maybe broken trace, or solder under some BGA chip.
Hopeless project, as looks like T2 issue.
